brief_description of the content in the: The JetBrains page provides information about AspectJ, a seamless aspect-oriented extension to the Java programming language. It mentions the @AspectJ argNames attribute, which is used to specify the names of the method parameters in the advice signature. The page reports if the value of the argNames attribute does not correspond to the actual method parameter name.
generated_rule_explanation from GPT-4: The rule 'advice_argNames_consistency_check' checks all classes and their methods. If a method has the '@AspectJ' annotation, it retrieves the value of the 'argNames' attribute. If the 'argNames' attribute is not empty, it asserts that the method has a parameter with the same name as the 'argNames' attribute value. If the assertion fails, it generates a message indicating that the 'argNames' attribute value does not correspond to the actual method parameter name.
PRE_model_validation: The generated rule is valid according to the syntax of RSL and the content addressed in the JetBrains web page. It uses only the built-in functions and does not introduce any new ones. The rule checks the consistency between the 'argNames' attribute value and the actual method parameter name, which is the topic addressed in the JetBrains web page.
